ai-mn139:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-mn139:2.1_0: “Mendicants, I shall teach you the analysis of non-conflict.
ai-mn139:2.2_0: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-mn139:3.1_0: “Don’t indulge in sensual pleasures, which are low, crude, ordinary, ignoble, and pointless. And don’t indulge in self-mortification, which is painful, ignoble, and pointless.
ai-mn139:3.2_0: Avoiding these two extremes, the Realized One woke up by understanding the middle way of practice, which gives vision and knowledge, and leads to peace, direct knowledge, awakening, and extinguishment.
ai-mn139:3.3_0: Know what it means to flatter and to rebuke.
ai-mn139:3.4_0: Knowing these, avoid them, and just teach Dhamma.
ai-mn139:3.5_0: Know how to assess different kinds of pleasure.
ai-mn139:3.7_0: Don’t talk behind people’s backs, and don’t speak sharply in their presence.
ai-mn139:3.9_0: Don’t insist on local terminology and don’t override normal usage.
ai-mn139:3.10_0: This is the recitation passage for the analysis of non-conflict.
ai-mn139:4.1_0: ‘Don’t indulge in sensual pleasures, which are low, crude, ordinary, ignoble, and pointless. And don’t indulge in self-mortification, which is painful, ignoble, and pointless.’
ai-mn139:4.2_0: This is what was said, but in regard to what was it said?
ai-mn139:4.3_0: Pleasure linked to sensuality is low, crude, ordinary, ignoble, and pointless. Indulging in such happiness is a principle beset by pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the wrong way.
ai-mn139:4.4_0: Breaking off such indulgence is a principle free of pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the right way.
ai-mn139:4.5_0: Indulging in self-mortification is painful, ignoble, and pointless. It is a principle beset by pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the wrong way.
ai-mn139:4.6_0: Breaking off such indulgence is a principle free of pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the right way.
ai-mn139:4.7_0: ‘Don’t indulge in sensual pleasures, which are low, crude, ordinary, ignoble, and pointless. And don’t indulge in self-mortification, which is painful, ignoble, and pointless.’
ai-mn139:4.8_0: That’s why I said what I said.
ai-mn139:5.1_0: ‘Avoiding these two extremes, the Realized One woke up by understanding the middle way of practice, which gives vision and knowledge, and leads to peace, direct knowledge, awakening, and extinguishment.’
ai-mn139:5.2_0: This is what was said, but in regard to what was it said?
ai-mn139:5.4_0: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
ai-mn139:5.5_0: ‘Avoiding these two extremes, the Realized One woke up by understanding the middle way of practice, which gives vision and knowledge, and leads to peace, direct knowledge, awakening, and extinguishment.’
ai-mn139:5.6_0: That’s why I said what I said.
ai-mn139:6.1_0: ‘Know what it means to flatter and to rebuke.
ai-mn139:6.2_0: Knowing these, avoid them, and just teach Dhamma.’
ai-mn139:6.3_0: This is what was said, but in regard to what was it said?
ai-mn139:7.1_0: And how is there flattering and rebuking without teaching Dhamma?
ai-mn139:7.2_0: You don’t say: ‘Pleasure linked to sensuality is low, crude, ordinary, ignoble, and pointless. All those who indulge in such happiness are beset by pain, harm, stress, and fever, and they are practicing the wrong way.’
ai-mn139:7.4_0: You don’t say: ‘Pleasure linked to sensuality is low, crude, ordinary, ignoble, and pointless. All those who have broken off such indulgence are free of pain, harm, stress, and fever, and they are practicing the right way.’
ai-mn139:7.6_0: You don’t say: ‘Indulging in self-mortification is painful, ignoble, and pointless. All those who have broken off such indulgence are beset by pain, harm, stress, and fever, and they are practicing the wrong way.’
ai-mn139:7.8_0: You don’t say: ‘Indulging in self-mortification is painful, ignoble, and pointless. All those who have broken off such indulgence are free of pain, harm, stress, and fever, and they are practicing the right way.’
ai-mn139:7.10_0: You don’t say: ‘All those who have not given up the fetters of rebirth are beset by pain, harm, stress, and fever, and they are practicing the wrong way.’
ai-mn139:7.12_0: You don’t say: ‘All those who have given up the fetters of rebirth are free of pain, harm, stress, and fever, and they are practicing the right way.’
ai-mn139:7.14_0: That’s how there is flattering and rebuking without teaching Dhamma.
ai-mn139:8.1_0: And how is there neither flattering nor rebuking, and just teaching Dhamma?
ai-mn139:8.2_0: You don’t say: ‘Pleasure linked to sensuality is low, crude, ordinary, ignoble, and pointless. All those who indulge in such happiness are beset by pain, harm, stress, and fever, and they are practicing the wrong way.’
ai-mn139:8.3_0: Rather, by saying this you just teach Dhamma:
ai-mn139:8.4_0: ‘The indulgence is a principle beset by pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the wrong way.’
ai-mn139:8.7_0: You don’t say: ‘Pleasure linked to sensuality is low, crude, ordinary, ignoble, and pointless. All those who have broken off such indulgence are free of pain, harm, stress, and fever, and they are practicing the right way.’
ai-mn139:8.8_0: Rather, by saying this you just teach Dhamma:
ai-mn139:8.9_0: ‘Breaking off the indulgence is a principle free of pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the right way.’
ai-mn139:8.12_0: You don’t say: ‘Indulging in self-mortification is painful, ignoble, and pointless. All those who have broken off such indulgence are beset by pain, harm, stress, and fever, and they are practicing the wrong way.’
ai-mn139:8.13_0: Rather, by saying this you just teach Dhamma:
ai-mn139:8.14_0: ‘The indulgence is a principle beset by pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the wrong way.’
ai-mn139:8.17_0: You don’t say: ‘Indulging in self-mortification is painful, ignoble, and pointless. All those who have broken off such indulgence are free of pain, harm, stress, and fever, and they are practicing the right way.’
ai-mn139:8.18_0: Rather, by saying this you just teach Dhamma:
ai-mn139:8.19_0: ‘Breaking off the indulgence is a principle free of pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the right way.’
ai-mn139:8.22_0: You don’t say: ‘All those who have not given up the fetters of rebirth are beset by pain, harm, stress, and fever, and they are practicing the wrong way.’
ai-mn139:8.23_0: Rather, by saying this you just teach Dhamma:
ai-mn139:8.24_0: ‘When the fetter of rebirth is not given up, rebirth is also not given up.’
ai-mn139:8.26_0: You don’t say: ‘All those who have given up the fetters of rebirth are free of pain, harm, stress, and fever, and they are practicing the right way.’
ai-mn139:8.27_0: Rather, by saying this you just teach Dhamma:
ai-mn139:8.28_0: ‘When the fetter of rebirth is given up, rebirth is also given up.’
ai-mn139:8.30_0: That’s how there is neither flattering nor rebuking, and just teaching Dhamma.
ai-mn139:8.31_0: ‘Know what it means to flatter and to rebuke.
ai-mn139:8.32_0: Knowing these, avoid them, and just teach Dhamma.’
ai-mn139:8.33_0: That’s why I said what I said.
ai-mn139:9.1_0: ‘Know how to assess different kinds of pleasure.
ai-mn139:9.3_0: This is what was said, but in regard to what was it said?
ai-mn139:9.4_0: There are these five kinds of sensual stimulation.
ai-mn139:9.6_0: Sights known by the eye that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.
ai-mn139:9.10_0: Touches known by the body that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.
ai-mn139:9.11_0: these, monks, are the five strands of sense pleasure.
ai-mn139:9.12_0: The pleasure and happiness that arise from these five kinds of sensual stimulation is called sensual pleasure—a filthy, common, ignoble pleasure.
ai-mn139:9.13_0: Such pleasure should not be cultivated or developed, but should be feared, I say.
ai-mn139:9.14_0: Now, take a mendicant who, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.
ai-mn139:9.15_0: As the placing of the mind and keeping it connected are stilled, they enter and remain in the second absorption ...
ai-mn139:9.17_0: dwells having attained the fourth absorption.
ai-mn139:9.18_0: This is called the pleasure of renunciation, the pleasure of seclusion, the pleasure of peace, the pleasure of awakening.
ai-mn139:9.19_0: Such pleasure should be cultivated and developed, and should not be feared, I say.
ai-mn139:9.20_0: ‘Know how to assess different kinds of pleasure.
ai-mn139:9.22_0: That’s why I said what I said.
ai-mn139:10.1_0: ‘Don’t talk behind people’s backs, and don’t speak sharply in their presence.’
ai-mn139:10.3_0: That’s what I said, but why did I say it?
ai-mn139:10.4_0: When you know that what you’re untrue, false, and harmful, then if at all possible you should not speak.
ai-mn139:10.5_0: When you know that what you say behind someone’s back is true and correct, but harmful, then you should train yourself not to speak.
ai-mn139:10.6_0: When you know that what you say behind someone’s back is true, correct, and beneficial, then you should know the right time to speak.
ai-mn139:10.7_0: When you know that your sharp words in someone’s presence are untrue, false, and harmful, then if at all possible you should not speak.
ai-mn139:10.8_0: When you know that your sharp words in someone’s presence are true and correct, but harmful, then you should train yourself not to speak.
ai-mn139:10.9_0: When you know that your sharp words in someone’s presence are true, correct, and beneficial, then you should know the right time to speak.
ai-mn139:10.10_0: ‘Don’t talk behind people’s backs, and don’t speak sharply in their presence.’
ai-mn139:10.11_0: That’s why I said what I said.
ai-mn139:11.2_0: This is what was said, but in regard to what was it said?
ai-mn139:11.3_0: When speaking hurriedly, your body gets tired, your mind gets stressed, your voice gets stressed, your throat gets sore, and your words become unclear and hard to understand.
ai-mn139:11.4_0: When speaking hurriedly, your body doesn’t get tired, your mind doesn’t get stressed, your voice gets stressed, your throat gets sore, and your words become unclear and hard to understand.
ai-mn139:11.6_0: That’s why I said what I said.
ai-mn139:12.1_0: ‘Don’t insist on local terminology and don’t override normal usage.’
ai-mn139:12.2_0: This is what was said, but in regard to what was it said?
ai-mn139:12.3_0: And how do you insist on local terminology and override normal usage?
ai-mn139:12.4_0: It’s when in different localities the same thing is known as a ‘plate’, a ‘bowl’, a ‘cup’, a ‘dish’, a ‘basin’, a ‘tureen’, or a ‘porringer’.
ai-mn139:12.5_0: And however it is known in those various localities, you speak accordingly, obstinately sticking to that and insisting:
ai-mn139:12.6_0: ‘This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.’
ai-mn139:12.7_0: That’s how you insist on local terminology and override normal usage.
ai-mn139:12.8_0: And how do you not insist on local terminology and not override normal usage?
ai-mn139:12.9_0: It’s when in different localities the same thing is known as a ‘plate’, a ‘bowl’, a ‘cup’, a ‘dish’, a ‘basin’, a ‘tureen’, or a ‘porringer’.
ai-mn139:12.10_0: And however it is known in those various localities, you speak accordingly, thinking: ‘It seems that the venerables are referring to this.’
ai-mn139:12.11_0: That’s how you don’t insist on local terminology and don’t override normal usage.
ai-mn139:12.12_0: ‘Don’t insist on local terminology and don’t override normal usage.’
ai-mn139:12.13_0: That’s why I said what I said.
ai-mn139:13.1_0: Now, mendicants, pleasure linked to sensuality is low, crude, ordinary, ignoble, and pointless. Indulging in such happiness is a principle beset by pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the wrong way.
ai-mn139:13.3_0: That’s why this is a principle beset by conflict.
ai-mn139:13.4_0: Breaking off such indulgence is a principle free of pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the right way.
ai-mn139:13.6_0: That’s why this is a principle free of conflict.
ai-mn139:13.7_0: Indulging in self-mortification is painful, ignoble, and pointless. It is a principle beset by pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the wrong way.
ai-mn139:13.9_0: That’s why this is a principle beset by conflict.
ai-mn139:13.10_0: Breaking off such indulgence is a principle free of pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the right way.
ai-mn139:13.12_0: That’s why this is a principle free of conflict.
ai-mn139:13.13_0: The middle way of practice by which the Realized One was awakened gives vision and knowledge, and leads to peace, direct knowledge, awakening, and extinguishment. It is a principle free of pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the right way.
ai-mn139:13.15_0: That’s why this is a principle free of conflict.
ai-mn139:13.16_0: Flattering and rebuking without teaching Dhamma is a principle beset by pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the wrong way.
ai-mn139:13.18_0: That’s why this is a principle beset by conflict.
ai-mn139:13.19_0: Neither flattering nor rebuking, and just teaching Dhamma is a principle free of pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the right way.
ai-mn139:13.21_0: That’s why this is a principle free of conflict.
ai-mn139:13.22_0: Sensual pleasure—a filthy, common, ignoble pleasure—is a principle beset by pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the wrong way.
ai-mn139:13.24_0: That’s why this is a principle beset by conflict.
ai-mn139:13.25_0: The pleasure of renunciation, the pleasure of seclusion, the pleasure of peace, the pleasure of awakening is a principle free of pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the right way.
ai-mn139:13.27_0: That’s why this is a principle free of conflict.
ai-mn139:13.28_0: Saying untrue, false, and harmful things behind someone’s back is a principle beset by pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the wrong way.
ai-mn139:13.30_0: That’s why this is a principle beset by conflict.
ai-mn139:13.31_0: Saying true and correct, but harmful things behind someone’s back is a principle beset by pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the wrong way.
ai-mn139:13.33_0: That’s why this is a principle beset by conflict.
ai-mn139:13.34_0: Saying true and correct, but harmful things behind someone’s back is a principle free of pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the right way.
ai-mn139:13.36_0: That’s why this is a principle free of conflict.
ai-mn139:13.37_0: Saying untrue, false, and harmful things in someone’s presence is a principle beset by pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the wrong way.
ai-mn139:13.39_0: That’s why this is a principle beset by conflict.
ai-mn139:13.40_0: Saying true and correct, but harmful things in someone’s presence is a principle beset by pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the wrong way.
ai-mn139:13.42_0: That’s why this is a principle beset by conflict.
ai-mn139:13.43_0: Saying true, correct, and beneficial things in someone’s presence is a principle free of pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the right way.
ai-mn139:13.45_0: That’s why this is a principle free of conflict.
ai-mn139:13.46_0: Saying this is a principle beset by pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the wrong way.
ai-mn139:13.48_0: That’s why this is a principle beset by conflict.
ai-mn139:13.49_0: Saying ‘This is a principle free of pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the right way.’
ai-mn139:13.51_0: That’s why this is a principle free of conflict.
ai-mn139:13.52_0: Insisting on local terminology and overriding normal usage is a principle beset by pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the wrong way.
ai-mn139:13.54_0: That’s why this is a principle beset by conflict.
ai-mn139:13.55_0: Not insisting on local terminology and not overriding normal usage is a principle free of pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the right way.
ai-mn139:13.57_0: That’s why this is a principle free of conflict.
ai-mn139:14.1_0: So you should train like this: ‘We shall know the principles beset by conflict and the principles free of conflict.
ai-mn139:14.2_0: Knowing this, we will practice the way free of conflict.’
ai-mn139:14.3_0: And, mendicants, Subhūti, the gentleman, practices the way of non-conflict.”
ai-mn139:14.4_0: That is what the Buddha said.
ai-mn139:14.5_0: Satisfied, the mendicants were happy with what the Buddha said.
